titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Leslie T. Webster papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff FA204

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-10-16 00:17:14 -0400.

did.unittitle: Leslie T. Webster papers, Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research Scientific Staff

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Leslie Tillotson Webster, 1894-1943, physician and researcher worked in epidemiology and bacteriology at The Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research from 1920 until his death in 1943. He was a pioneer in the investigation of the importance of natural resistance to disease and the experimental facts on the basis of which the spread of epidemics can be explained. Author of book "Rabies" published in 1942.

eventgrp.event: M.D. Johns Hopkins Medical School, Baltimore, Md.
Assistant Resident Pathologist, Johns Hopkins Hospital
Assistant in Pathology, Johns Hopkins Medical School
Assistant (Pathology and Bacteriology) Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research, New York, N.Y.
Prize of 1000 francs Univ. of Berne Medical Faculty (Research in encephalitis)
Annual Award from Dog Writers' Association (Outstanding service to dogs in field of medical research)

bioghist.p: Member of: Society of Experimental Biology and Medicine, American Society for Experimental Pathology, American Epidemiological Society, American Association of Pathologists and Bacteriologists, Harvey Society, Society of American Bacteriologists, American Association for the Advancement of Science, American Public Health Association, Alpha Delta Phi, Alpha Omega Alpha, Phi Beta Kappa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Administrative correspondence; biographical information; bibliography; diary; film.
Consists primarily of administrative correspondence, copy of diary (1929-1943), notes on "Experimental Epidemiology" and silent film left to The Rockefeller University by Mrs. Webster.
Also includes Leslie T. Webster's 1919 diary.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bibliography; photographs; some newspaper clippings; Memorial Minute.

did.unittitle: Obituary note written by Peter K. Olitsky

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes thoughts on family life as well as on progress of laboratory activities and world affairs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily with Simon Flexner and Business Manager and deals with budgetary matters, laboratory workers and assistants; laboratory equipment, supplies, animals and projected research plans.
Includes original application for appointment and recommendation by Dr. W.G. MacCallum of Johns Hopkins University, (holograph).

did.unittitle: To Simon Flexner from L.T. Webster stating he will not accept offer in pediatrics made by Dr. Park of Johns Hopkins Hospital

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Headed: "Older notes 1926-1940 (about 40 pages)" Photocopy assembled from handwritten notes; tables and reprints. [Maybe draft of 1946 posthumous publication].

did.physloc: Consult Archivist for location of film reel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Study of epidemic patterns in a rabbit colony.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Film left to the Rockefeller University by Mrs. Webster.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be closed to research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be closed to researchers at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/Head of Reference.

did.unittitle: Diary by Leslie T. Webster in Labrador

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: In May 1919 Dr. Leslie T. Webster graduated from John Hopkins Medical School second in his class and left for Labrador with his classmate Dr. Charles Parsons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed by his widow, Emily de Forest White.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: No quotations from the Webster diary are allowed without prior consent from the Webster family.
